Reading List

Books are windows to new worlds, sources of inspiration, and catalysts for creativity. Here's a curated list of books that have shaped my thinking, along with some that I'm excited to explore.

Currently Reading

Kissinger: A Biography

by Walter Isaacson

A comprehensive look at one of the most influential and controversial diplomats in American history.

BiographyPoliticsHistory

Read

The Psychology of Money

by Morgan Housel

★★★★★

A collection of timeless lessons about wealth, greed, and happiness, exploring the psychology behind our financial decisions.

FinancePsychologyPersonal Development

"Brilliant insights into how our psychology affects our financial decisions."

Neuromancer

by William Gibson

★★★★★

The groundbreaking cyberpunk novel that coined the term "cyberspace" and influenced countless works of science fiction.

Science FictionCyberpunk

"A masterpiece that defined cyberpunk and predicted many aspects of our digital world."

Dear Reader

by Michael Malice

★★★★★

The unauthorized autobiography of Kim Jong Il, offering a satirical yet informative look into North Korea's dictatorship.

PoliticsHistorySatire

"A fascinating blend of humor and insight into one of the world's most secretive regimes."

The New Right

by Michael Malice

★★★★

A journey exploring the fringes of American politics and the emergence of new political movements.

PoliticsCurrent Events

"An interesting exploration of modern political movements and ideologies."

The Story of Civilization

by Will Durant

★★★★★

A monumental work covering the history of human civilization, from its earliest beginnings to modern times.

HistoryPhilosophyCulture

"An incredible journey through human history and cultural development."

Thus Spoke Zarathustra

by Friedrich Nietzsche

★★★★

Nietzsche's philosophical novel presenting his ideas about the death of God, the Übermensch, and eternal recurrence.

PhilosophyLiterature

"A challenging but rewarding exploration of Nietzsche's philosophy."

Boyd

by Robert Coram

★★★★

The biography of John Boyd, the fighter pilot whose theories of warfare revolutionized military strategy.

BiographyMilitaryHistory

"Fascinating look at a brilliant military theorist who changed modern warfare."

On War

by Carl von Clausewitz

★★★

The classic treatise on military strategy and the nature of warfare.

MilitaryStrategyHistory

"Dense but foundational work on military theory and strategy."

33 Strategies of War

by Robert Greene

★★★

A comprehensive guide to strategic thinking, drawing from military history and applying it to modern life.

StrategyHistoryMilitary

"Interesting historical examples applied to modern strategic thinking."

We Are Legion (We Are Bob)

by Dennis E. Taylor

★★★★★

Book 1 of the Bobiverse series, following a reincarnated human consciousness exploring the cosmos.

Science FictionSpace Opera

"Brilliant blend of humor and hard sci-fi concepts."

For We Are Many

by Dennis E. Taylor

★★★★★

Book 2 of the Bobiverse series, expanding the scope of Bob's adventures.

Science FictionSpace Opera

"Excellent continuation that builds on the first book's foundation."

All These Worlds

by Dennis E. Taylor

★★★★★

Book 3 of the Bobiverse series, bringing the original trilogy to a satisfying conclusion.

Science FictionSpace Opera

"A fantastic conclusion to an innovative sci-fi series."

Heaven's River

by Dennis E. Taylor

★★★★

Book 4 of the Bobiverse series, taking the story in new and unexpected directions.

Science FictionSpace Opera

"An interesting new direction for the series."

Endurance

by Alfred Lansing

★★★★

The incredible true story of Ernest Shackleton's survival after his Antarctic expedition goes wrong.

HistoryAdventureBiography

"An amazing tale of human endurance and leadership."

Strategy: A History

by Lawrence Freedman

★★★

A comprehensive exploration of strategy across military, political, and business domains.

HistoryStrategyMilitary

"Thorough examination of strategic thinking throughout history."

The Skeptics' Guide to the Future

by Dr. Steven Novella

★★★★

An examination of how past science fiction and scientific predictions inform our understanding of future technologies.

ScienceTechnologyFuturism

"Insightful analysis of technological predictions and their likelihood."

Games People Play

by Eric Berne

★★★★★

A groundbreaking analysis of the psychology behind human social interactions and relationships.

PsychologySocial Science

"A fascinating look at human behavior patterns that changed how I view social interactions."

Snow Crash

by Neal Stephenson

★★★★★

A mind-bending cyberpunk novel that predicted many aspects of our digital world.

Science FictionCyberpunk

"Brilliant mix of technology, mythology, and social commentary that feels more relevant every year."

The Coming of Conan the Cimmerian

by Robert E. Howard

★★★★★

The original Conan stories, showcasing Howard's masterful world-building and action-packed storytelling.

FantasySword and Sorcery

"Raw, powerful storytelling that defined a genre."

The War of Art

by Steven Pressfield

★★★★★

A guide to overcoming creative blocks and the internal resistance that prevents us from achieving our goals.

Self-HelpCreativity

"Essential reading for any creative person struggling with resistance."

Wings on My Sleeve

by Eric 'Winkle' Brown

★★★★

The autobiography of one of aviation's greatest test pilots, who flew a record-breaking number of different aircraft.

AviationBiographyMilitary History

"Fascinating account of aviation history through the eyes of a legendary test pilot."

The Player of Games

by Iain M. Banks

★★★★★

A masterpiece of science fiction exploring culture, politics, and strategy through the lens of gaming.

Science FictionSpace Opera

"Brilliant exploration of games, culture, and politics in a far-future setting."

The Dictator's Handbook

by Bruce Bueno de Mesquita, Alastair Smith

★★★★★

A provocative analysis of how political leaders gain and maintain power through strategic decision-making.

PoliticsPolitical ScienceHistory

"Eye-opening perspective on political power and leadership dynamics."

Atomic Adventures

by James Mahaffey

★★★

A journey through the stranger-than-fiction history of nuclear science and its eccentric pioneers.

ScienceHistoryPhysics

"Interesting collection of nuclear science stories and discoveries."

Ignition!

by John Drury Clark

★★★★★

A humorous and technical history of rocket fuel development during the space race.

ScienceHistorySpace

"Entertaining and informative look at the dangerous early days of rocket science."

12 Rules for Life

by Jordan B. Peterson

★★

A self-help book combining psychology, mythology, and philosophy to present rules for living.

Self-HelpPsychologyPhilosophy

"Some interesting ideas but overall disappointing."

Prediction Machines

by Ajay Agrawal, Joshua Gans, Avi Goldfarb

★★

An economic perspective on artificial intelligence and its impact on business and society.

TechnologyEconomicsBusiness

"Oversimplified take on AI's economic implications."

Chernobyl 01:23:40

by Andrew Leatherbarrow

★★★

A detailed account of the Chernobyl nuclear disaster, its causes, and aftermath.

HistoryScienceDisaster

"Solid overview of the Chernobyl disaster with some new insights."

The Selfish Gene

by Richard Dawkins

★★★★

A groundbreaking look at evolution from the gene's perspective, revolutionizing our understanding of natural selection.

ScienceBiologyEvolution

"Influential perspective on evolution and genetic behavior."

Off to Be the Wizard

by Scott Meyer

★★★★★

Book 1 of Magic 2.0, where a computer programmer discovers reality can be manipulated like code.

Science FictionFantasyHumor

"Creative and entertaining blend of technology and fantasy."

Spell or High Water

by Scott Meyer

★★★

Book 2 of Magic 2.0, continuing the adventures in a world where reality is programmable.

Science FictionFantasyHumor

"Decent continuation of the series but not as strong as the first."

An Unwelcome Quest

by Scott Meyer

★★★

Book 3 of Magic 2.0, where the programmer-wizards face new challenges.

Science FictionFantasyHumor

"Fun but starting to show diminishing returns for the series."

Talent Is Overrated

by Geoff Colvin

★★★

An exploration of what really drives high performance, challenging the notion of natural talent.

PsychologySelf-HelpBusiness

"Interesting perspective on deliberate practice and skill development."

Outliers

by Malcolm Gladwell

★★★★

An investigation into the factors that contribute to high levels of success.

PsychologySociologyBusiness

"Fascinating look at the hidden factors behind success stories."

Algorithms to Live By

by Brian Christian, Tom Griffiths

★★★★

How computer algorithms can be applied to our everyday lives to solve common decision-making problems.

Computer SciencePsychologySelf-Help

"Clever application of computer science concepts to real-life decisions."

Hackers

by Steven Levy

★★★★

The fascinating history of the computer revolution and the innovators who made it happen.

TechnologyHistoryBiography

"Essential history of hacker culture and the early days of computing."

Breakfast of Champions

by Kurt Vonnegut

★★★★

A wildly satirical novel about the American condition, featuring Vonnegut's signature dark humor.

FictionLiterary FictionSatire

"Classic Vonnegut satire with memorable characters and illustrations."

Deadeye Dick

by Kurt Vonnegut

★★★★

A dark comedy about a man who accidentally killed someone as a child.

FictionLiterary FictionSatire

"Dark and thought-provoking exploration of guilt and responsibility."

Slaughterhouse-Five

by Kurt Vonnegut

★★★★★

A masterpiece of anti-war fiction, following Billy Pilgrim's time-traveling experiences during WWII.

FictionScience FictionLiterary Fiction

"A profound and innovative exploration of war, time, and human nature."

Mother Night

by Kurt Vonnegut

★★★★★

A dark tale about an American spy in Nazi Germany who questions his own identity.

FictionLiterary FictionWar Fiction

"Powerful exploration of identity and moral complexity."

Cat's Cradle

by Kurt Vonnegut

★★★★★

A satirical commentary on modern man and his madness, involving a deadly form of ice.

FictionScience FictionSatire

"Brilliant satire of science, religion, and human folly."

Bluebeard

by Kurt Vonnegut

★★★★

The autobiography of an abstract expressionist painter with a mysterious secret in his barn.

FictionLiterary FictionArt

"Fascinating meditation on art, war, and creativity."

The Martian

by Andy Weir

★★★★★

A gripping tale of survival on Mars, combining humor with hard science.

Science FictionHard Science FictionAdventure

"Brilliant blend of scientific accuracy and engaging storytelling."

Tropic of Cancer

by Henry Miller

★★★★

A groundbreaking semi-autobiographical novel about Miller's life as a struggling writer in Paris.

Literary FictionAutobiographyClassics

"Raw and honest exploration of the artistic life."

The Dip

by Seth Godin

★★★★

A short guide about knowing when to quit and when to stick with something.

BusinessSelf-HelpPersonal Development

"Concise and practical advice about strategic quitting."

Unstoppable

by Bill Nye

★★★★

An optimistic look at how science and technology can solve our biggest challenges.

ScienceTechnologyEnvironmental Science

"Engaging overview of scientific solutions to global problems."

Sapiens

by Yuval Noah Harari

★★★★★

A thought-provoking exploration of human history from ancient evolution to modern civilization.

HistoryAnthropologyScience

"Fascinating perspective on human history and development."

Heart of Darkness

by Joseph Conrad

★★★★

A powerful narrative about imperialism and the darkness within human nature.

FictionClassicsLiterary Fiction

"Profound exploration of human nature and colonialism."

The C++ Programming Language

by Bjarne Stroustrup

★★★★★

The definitive guide to C++ by its creator, covering both basic concepts and advanced features.

ProgrammingComputer ScienceTechnical

"The authoritative resource for understanding C++ in depth."

Skunk Works

by Ben R. Rich, Leo Janos

★★★★★

An insider's account of Lockheed's legendary aerospace development division.

AviationHistoryTechnology

"Fascinating look into advanced aerospace development and innovation."

Masters of Doom

by David Kushner

★★★★

The story of id Software's John Carmack and John Romero, creators of Doom and Quake.

TechnologyBiographyGaming

"Compelling story of gaming history and technological innovation."

The Search for Exoplanets

by Joshua N. Winn

★★★★

A comprehensive exploration of the science behind discovering and studying planets outside our solar system.

ScienceAstronomyPhysics

"Fascinating look at modern exoplanet detection and research methods."

Lolita

by Vladimir Nabokov

★★★★★

A controversial masterpiece of 20th-century literature, notable for its complex narrative and linguistic artistry.

Literary FictionClassicsControversial Literature

"Brilliant and disturbing, showcasing Nabokov's masterful command of language."

I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell

by Tucker Max

★★★

A collection of outrageous true stories from the author's experiences.

HumorMemoirComedy

"Entertaining but shallow collection of wild stories."

The Norsemen - Understanding Vikings and Their Culture

by Professor Michael D.C. Drout

★★★★★

A comprehensive overview of Viking history, culture, and influence on the medieval world.

HistoryMedieval StudiesCultural Studies

by Edith Hamilton

★★★

A classic compendium of Greek, Roman, and Norse mythology.

An exploration of the most perplexing scientific anomalies and mysteries that challenge our understanding.

The first comprehensive biography of the entrepreneur behind Tesla, SpaceX, and PayPal.

Elon Musk

by Walter Isaacson

★★★★

A comprehensive biography of Elon Musk by the acclaimed biographer of Steve Jobs and Einstein.

"More recent and thorough examination of Musk's life and impact."

Einstein: His Life and Universe

by Walter Isaacson

A detailed biography of Albert Einstein, exploring both his scientific genius and personal life.
